Music.setInstrument: Sets to an instrument to play music.  %1 is type of the instrument (guitar, piano, ...).
Movie.submitMsg: Label on a button that submits the user's movie to a public gallery.
Puzzle.animal3Trait1:
Honey: A trait that bees have.
{{Identical|Honey}}
Puzzle.animal3Trait2:
Stinger: A trait that bees have.
{{Identical|Stinger}}
Puzzle.animal2Trait2:
Fur: A trait that cats have.
{{Identical|Fur}}
Maze.helpIfElse: callout - This is shown when the 'if-else' block is introduced.  For 'if-else' concatenate the words for 'if' and 'else/otherwise'.
Games.music:
title - Specifies that this is Blockly's '''Music''' game.
{{Identical|Music}}
Maze.moveForward: block text - Imperative or infinitive of a verb for a person moving (walking) in the direction he/she is facing.
Puzzle.error2:
An error message displayed if the user misplaced multiple blocks.

Parameters:
* %1 - number of blocks incorrectly placed, which is always greater than 1 (or the message Puzzle.error1 would be used).
Games.listVariable:
variable name - Default [https://github.com/google/blockly/wiki/Variables variable] representing a [https://github.com/google/blockly/wiki/Lists list].  This should be a single word, preferably short.
{{Identical|List}}
Turtle.fontTooltip: tooltip - This is shown on the block that lets the user specify the font [family], size, and style that should be used for subsequent displays of text.
Maze.whileTooltip: tooltip - Repeat the enclosed commands until the maze has been successfully completed (the end point reached).
Movie.helpText2b: Instructions.  Do not translate the word 'time' or the name 'y'.
Puzzle.tryAgain:
A message indicating that a visually distinguished block is incorrect and that the user should try to fix it.

The use of a new line character is optional.
Games.bird:
title - Specifies that this is Blockly's '''Bird''' game.
{{Identical|Bird}}
Bird.helpHeading: callout - This is shown as instruction for the first level.
Games.puzzle:
title - Specifies that this is Blockly's '''Puzzle''' game.  Use the word for a jigsaw puzzle.
{{Identical|Puzzle}}
Games.congratulations:
alert - This is displayed when the user solves the level.
{{Identical|Congratulation}}
Maze.ifTooltip: tooltip - 'path' refers to a path through a maze.
Puzzle.animal3HelpUrl:
The URL of a page with basic information about '''bees''', on the most appropriate linguistic edition of Wikipedia for the target language.
Make sure you use secure HTTPS links, to avoid generating mixed contents and security alerts in browsers when viewing the current page in a secure HTTPS session. If not using Wikipedia, make sure the target is non intrusive, but if in doubt, link to a page in another suitable language supported by a Wikimedia project.
Turtle.penTooltip: tooltip - Lifting the pen off the writing surface prevents anything from being drawn.  Lowering it (after it has been lifted) enables it to draw again.
Music.helpUseInstruments: Dialog telling user not to use only one musical instrument (piano, flute, etc).
Turtle.setColour: block text - Infinitive or imperative of a verb to specify the colour of the lines that should be drawn in the future by an imaginary pen.  This is followed by a block showing the colour.
Puzzle.animal1HelpUrl:
The URL of a page with basic information about '''ducks''', on the most appropriate linguistic edition of Wikipedia for the target language.
Make sure you use secure HTTPS links, to avoid generating mixed contents and security alerts in browsers when viewing the current page in a secure HTTPS session. If not using Wikipedia, make sure the target is non intrusive, but if in doubt, link to a page in another suitable language supported by a Wikimedia project.
Turtle.penDown: block text - Infinitive or imperative of a verb to lower a raised pen so that moving it leaves a mark on the writing surface.
Maze.turnTooltip: tooltip - Turns the icon on the screen representing the player 90 degrees counter-clockwise (left) or clockwise (right).
Puzzle.animal4Trait1:
Shell: A trait that snails have.
{{Identical|Shell}}
Games.linkTooltip: tooltip - Pressing this button will cause the current program to be saved and for a URL to be shown to later retrieve it.
Index.subTitle: Brief description of Blockly Games.
Puzzle.checkAnswers: A label on a button the user can press to check his/her answers.
Music.helpText2a: Introducing a new block: function or subroutines
Maze.helpRepeatMany: callout - This is a hint that the user should place a second block inside of a a 'repeat' block.
Maze.helpIf: callout - This is shown when the 'if' block is introduced.  An example of an 'if' block is: 'if there is a path to the left, turn left'.
Puzzle.animal2Trait1:
Whiskers: A trait that cats have.
{{Identical|Whisker}}
Puzzle.animal4Trait2:
Slime: A trait that snails have.
{{Identical|Slime}}
Turtle.submitMsg: Label on a button that submits the user's art to a public gallery.
Maze.helpRun: callout - This is shown after the user has created a program on the first level.
Puzzle.legs:
Prompt for the number of legs that an animal has.
{{Identical|Leg}}
Movie.width:
Label for a rectangle or line's width input.
{{Identical|Width}}
Pond.playerName:
Generic name for the player of this video game.
{{Identical|Player}}
Index.clearData: Text on button for deleting all the user's data.
Turtle.moveTooltip: tooltip - In this and subsequent messages, 'turtle' refers to a stylized turtle on the screen to represent a position and direction.  This imaginary turtle is carrying a pen in its tail, so moving the turtle draws a line (or curve, etc.).  You are encouraged to play with the [https://blockly.games/turtle Turtle application] before doing this translation.
Turtle.fontBold: [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus dropdown]] - Specifies that a typographic font should be [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emphasis_(typography) bold].
Games.submitted: alert - After the user has submitted his/her program to the gallery, it must wait for approval.  Please make this message funny!
Turtle.helpUseLoop: Dialog telling user to seek a better answer.
Music.helpText7a: Introducing a new block: a musical rest.
Games.submitTitle:
Label in front of a field where the user is requested to type a title for their work.
{{Identical|Title}}
Puzzle.animal4HelpUrl:
The URL of a page with basic information about '''snails''', on the most appropriate linguistic edition of Wikipedia for the target language.
Make sure you use secure HTTPS links, to avoid generating mixed contents and security alerts in browsers when viewing the current page in a secure HTTPS session. If not using Wikipedia, make sure the target is non intrusive, but if in doubt, link to a page in another suitable language supported by a Wikimedia project.
Bird.helpElse: callout - This is shown when the user first needs to modify an 'if' block.
Puzzle.error0:
A congratulatory message displayed if the user placed all of the blocks correctly.

Parameters:
* %1 - number of blocks correctly placed.  It is always an integer greater than 1.

The use of a new line character is optional.
Turtle.helpUseLoop3: Dialog telling user to seek a simpler answer.
Bird.positionTooltip: tooltip - (x, y) marks the coordinate of bird, (0, 0) is the bottom left corner and (100, 100) top right.
Maze.helpCapacity: callout - This is shown after the user has used all the blocks permitted on this level.
Gallery:
Display of art created by user's programs.
{{Identical|Gallery}}
Games.resetTooltip: tooltip - Pressing this button restores the player to the start position and enables the user's program to be run again.
Games.linesOfCode1: alert - Displayed when a level is complete.
Movie.helpLayer: Dialog telling user to change the order of their program.
Turtle.fontSize:
block text - This precedes a number specifying the size of the typographic font that should be used when displaying text.  This appears in the same block as 'font', so that word should not be repeated.
{{Identical|Font size}}
Music.pitchTooltip: tooltip - Describes a musical note selector.  'C4' (also known as 'DO') is the note in the center of a piano keyboard and is represented as the number 7.
Movie.y1: Label for the y-coordinate of the start of a line.
Maze.runTooltip: tooltip - Pressing this button runs the computer program the user has written to move the player through the maze.
Puzzle.picture:
Prompt for a picture of an animal.
{{Identical|Picture}}
Bird.helpHasWorm: callout - This is shown when the 'does not have worm' block is introduced.
Turtle.galleryTooltip: tooltip - Pressing this button opens a gallery of drawings made by other users.
Movie.colourTooltip: tooltip - Changes the colour of ink in the pen carried by the turtle.
Bird.noWormTooltip: tooltip - The bird wants to get the worm.
Pond.cannonTooltip: Tooltip for the block that allows players to shoot at other players.
Music.helpText6a: Introducing a new block that changes musical instruments.
Movie.helpText6: Instructions.  Drawing hands on a picture of a person.
Puzzle.traits:
Prompt for a couple of traits of an animal (e.g. Duck: feathers, beak).
{{Identical|Trait}}
Games.helpAbort: callout - This dialog gives the user the option to skip this level.
Games.resetProgram:
button label - Pressing this button causes the output of the program to be erased but does not delete the user's program).
{{Identical|Reset}}
Turtle.moveBackward: [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus dropdown]] - Infinitive or imperative of a verb telling a turtle to move (walk) in the direction opposite to where he/she is facing.  This is followed by a number indicating how far (how many pixels) to go.  Prefer a translation that has text in common with the translation of 'move forward'.
Turtle.colourTooltip: tooltip - Changes the colour of ink in the pen carried by the turtle.
Turtle.turnRight: [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus dropdown]] - Infinitive or imperative of verb telling a turtle to rotate clockwise.  This is followed by a number indicating how far (how many degrees) to turn.  Prefer a translation that has text in common with the translation of 'turn left by'.
Turtle.penUp: block text - Infinitive or imperative of a verb to lift up a pen so that moving it leaves no mark on the writing surface.
Pond.locYTooltip: Tooltip for the block that reports the player's vertical location.
Maze.helpStack: callout - The word words for 'stack' and 'blocks' should be the same as for stacking children's blocks. Use the imperative verb form appropriate for speaking to a child, gender unspecified.  If no gender-neutral singular/familiar form exists but a gender-neutral plural/formal form exists, use that instead.  Be sure to use the same translation of 'move forward' as above.
Maze.helpSkins: callout - This is a hint that the user can change the appearance of the player that moves within the maze.
Music.rest: Plays no music for a duration specified.  %1 is the duration (icon for whole, quarter, ...).
Turtle.print:
block text - Infinitive or imperative of a verb telling a turtle to display text on the screen.  This is always followed by a block indicating what should be printed.
{{Identical|Print}}
Puzzle.animal1Trait2:
Beak: A trait that ducks have.
{{Identical|Beak}}
Maze.turnLeft: [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus dropdown]] - Imperative or infinitive of a verb for a person turning his head and body one quarter rotation counter-clockwise.  Prefer a translation that has text in common with the translation of 'turn right'.  See [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus]].
Puzzle.legsChoose:
Initial text displayed in a dropdown menu from which the user should choose an option.
{{Identical|Choose}}
Movie.submitTooltip: tooltip - Pressing this button causes the movie created by the user's program to be submitted to a gallery for other people to see.
Maze.doCode:
block text - Imperative or infinitive of a verb preceding one or more commands to a person.  This is part of [https://github.com/google/blockly/wiki/Loops#repeat repeat] and [https://github.com/google/blockly/wiki/IfElse#If_blocks if] blocks.
{{Identical|Do}}
Index.moreInfo: Link to a description of Blockly Games, intended for parents and teachers.
Index.startOver: Label next to button for deleting all the user's data.
Games.finalLevel: alert - This is displayed when the user solves the most difficult level and is going to go to the next game.
Movie.helpText2a: Instructions.  The play button looks like the video play button on YouTube.
Music.galleryTooltip: tooltip - Pressing this button opens a gallery of music made by other users.
Maze.helpMenu: callout - %1 will be replaced with an image of the dropdown menu that the user needs to click.
Music.submitTooltip: tooltip - Pressing this button causes the music created by the user's program to be submitted to a gallery for other people to see.
Pond.healthTooltip: Tooltip for the block that reports the player's health.
Bird.helpX: callout - This is shown when the 'x smaller than 50' block is introduced.
Movie.x2: Label for the x-coordinate of the end of a line.
Movie.galleryMsg: Label on a button that opens a gallery of movies made by other users.
Games.maze:
title - Specifies that this is Blockly's '''Maze''' game.
{{Identical|Maze}}
Turtle.fontItalic: [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus dropdown]] - Specifies that a typographic font should be [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italics italic].
Maze.ifelseTooltip: tooltip - 'path' refers to a path through a maze.
Maze.helpOneTopBlock: callout - This is displayed if a user attempts to run a program composed of multiple stacks of blocks, letting them know they need to create a single stack.
Music.firstPart: Example name of a function that plays the first part of some music.
Pond.documentation:
Text on the button that opens the language reference documentation.
{{Identical|Documentation}}
Maze.repeatUntil: block text - Imperative or infinitive of a verb to repeat the following commands.  The phrase is followed by the symbol denoting the end of the maze.
Maze.helpReset: callout - This is shown after the user has run a program that does not solve the maze.
Games.name: The project name.
Games.blocks:
Label on a tab that contains blocks editor.
{{Identical|Block}}
Turtle.font:
block text - This precedes a dropdown menu specifying the typographic font [family] that should be used when displaying text.
{{Identical|Font}}
Puzzle.animal2HelpUrl:
The URL of a page with basic information about '''cats''', on the most appropriate linguistic edition of Wikipedia for the target language.
Make sure you use secure HTTPS links, to avoid generating mixed contents and security alerts in browsers when viewing the current page in a secure HTTPS session. If not using Wikipedia, make sure the target is non intrusive, but if in doubt, link to a page in another suitable language supported by a Wikimedia project.
Puzzle.animal1Trait1:
Feathers: A trait that ducks have.
{{Identical|Feather}}
Turtle.hideTurtle: block text - Infinitive or imperative of a verb telling a turtle to hide itself (become invisible).
Maze.capacity0: warning - No more blocks may be added until some are removed.  Please include '%0' in the translated string.  It will be replaced with '0' and made bold.
Movie.radius:
Label for a circle's radius input.
{{Identical|Radius}}
Movie.setColour: block text - Infinitive or imperative of a verb to specify the colour of the lines that should be drawn in the future by an imaginary pen.  This is followed by a block showing the colour.
Maze.elseCode:
block text - Conjunction meaning 'otherwise', introducing commands to be performed if a previous condition was not true, as in 'if x>3, do this, else do that'.  See [https://github.com/google/blockly/wiki/IfElse#If-Else_blocks].
{{Identical|Else}}
Pond.pendulumName:
Name for a player that moves back and forth.
{{Identical|Pendulum}}
Maze.resetTooltip: tooltip - Pressing this button restores the player to the start position and enables the user's program to be run again.
Pond.helpText4: Instructions.  Do not translate the word 'swim'.
Games.pondTutor: title - Specifies that this is Blockly's '''Pond Tutor''' game.  It is a series of lessons or practice levels to allow users to play the more advanced '''Pond''' game (in your language: '''{{:Blockly:Games.pond/{{RelevantLanguage}}}}''').
Music.submitMsg: Label on a button that submits the user's art to a public gallery.
Maze.turnRight: [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus dropdown]] - Imperative or infinitive of a verb for a person turning his head and body one quarter rotation clockwise.  Prefer a translation that has text in common with the translation of 'turn left'.  See [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus]].
Games.linesOfCode2: alert - Displayed when a level is complete.  %1 is an integer greater than 1.
Maze.pathRight: [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus dropdown]] - Condensed form of 'if there is a path to the right', as in: 'if path to the right, turn right'.
Bird.noWorm: block text - Bird is not in possession of a worm.  This phrase is prefixed with 'if'.
Music.playNote: Plays one musical note.  %1 is duration of the note (icon for whole, quarter, ...), %2 is the pitch of the note (A3, B3, C4, ...).
Pond.docsTooltip: Tooltip for the button that opens the language reference documentation.
Pond.helpUseScan: Dialog telling user to seek a better answer.  Do not translate the word 'scan'.
Pond.stopTooltip: Tooltip for the block that allows players to stop.
Music.galleryMsg: Label on a button that opens a gallery of music made by other users.
Games.runProgram: button label - Pressing this button runs the computer program the user has written.
Pond.scaredName:
Name for a player that is scared.
{{Identical|Scared}}
Maze.moveForwardTooltip: tooltip - Moves the icon on the screen representing the player forward one square on the maze board.
Turtle.printTooltip: tooltip - Note that 'print' refers to displaying text on the screen, not on an external printer.
Games.pond: title - Specifies that this is Blockly's '''Pond''' game.
Pond.swimTooltip: Tooltip for the block that allows players to move.
Games.xmlError: alert - There was a problem loading a file previously saved by the user.  The most likely reason for the problem is that it was created with an earlier, incompatible version of Blockly.  This message will be followed by technical information useful to engineers trying to understand the problem.
Pond.scanTooltip: Tooltip for the block that allows players to scan for enemies.
Turtle.fontHelpUrl:
{{Optional}} The URL of a page with basic information about '''typographic fonts'''.
Make sure you use secure HTTPS links, to avoid generating mixed contents and security alerts in browsers when viewing the current page in a secure HTTPS session. If not using Wikipedia, make sure the target is non intrusive, but if in doubt, link to a page in another suitable language supported by a Wikimedia project.
Bird.headingTooltip: tooltip - Move in the direction of the given angle, where 0 means going horizontally to the right, and 90 straight up and 270 straight down.
Pond.locXTooltip: Tooltip for the block that reports the player's horizontal location.
Games.turtle:
title - Specifies that this is Blockly's '''Turtle''' game.
{{Identical|Turtle}}
Music.helpUseFunctions: Dialog telling user to seek a better answer.
Games.catProcedures:
category - Blocks related to [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Subroutine defining or using procedures/functions].
{{Identical|Functions}}
Turtle.turnLeft: [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus dropdown]] - Infinitive or imperative of verb telling a turtle to rotate counter-clockwise (anti-clockwise).  This is followed by a number indicating how far (how many degrees) to turn.  Prefer a translation that has text in common with the translation of 'turn right by'.
Turtle.fontNormal: [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus dropdown]] - Specifies that a typographic font should be normal (neither in italics or bold).
Maze.pathAhead: [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus dropdown]] - Condensed form of 'if there is a path ahead', as in: 'if path ahead, go forward'.  Prefer translation that has text in common with 'if path to the left' and 'if path to the right'.
Games.linkAlert:
alert - After the user has pressed a button to save his/her program, this provides the URL (%1) to retrieve the program.  The characters '

' indicate that a blank line will be displayed before the URL (in English).  Leave those in unless you move %1 to the beginning or middle of the text, in which case you should use your judgment about where blank lines would be most useful.

Parameters:
* %1 - URL of saved program.
Games.httpRequestError: alert - The URL is invalid or a server error occurred.  This message will be followed by technical information useful to engineers trying to understand the problem.
Maze.helpWallFollow: callout - This advises the user to solve a maze by keeping his/her left hand in contact with the wall while proceeding through it.  The final sentence is a warning that only advanced programmers should attempt this problem, as beginners tend to get frustrated.
Movie.helpText3: Instructions.  Do not translate the word 'time' or the name 'y'.
Games.nextLevel: alert - This is displayed when the user solves the level, inviting them to procede to the next level of difficulty.  %1 is an integer greater than 1.
Games.help:
button label - Pressing this button shows help information.
{{Identical|Help}}
Movie.galleryTooltip: tooltip - Pressing this button opens a gallery of movies made by other users.
Index.clear: Confirmation prompt for deleting all the user's data.
Puzzle.helpText: Instructions for the puzzle.  For context, see [https://blockly.games/puzzle Blockly Puzzle].
Music.helpText1: Instructions.  If your country has a song to the tune of 'Frère Jacques' use its name.  E.g. Bruder Jakob (German) or Kìa con bướm (Vietnamese).
Puzzle.error1:
An encouraging error message displayed if the user placed all blocks except 1 correctly.

If the number of incorrect blocks is 2 or more, Puzzle.error2 is used instead.
Pond.targetName:
Name for a player that does nothing.
{{Identical|Target}}
Turtle.setWidth: block text - Infinitive or imperative of a verb to set the width of the lines that should be drawn in the future by an imaginary pen.  This is followed by a number indicating the width in pixels (1 or greater).
Movie.x1: Label for the x-coordinate of the start of a line.
Turtle.helpUseLoop4: Dialog telling user to seek a simpler answer.
Maze.helpRepeat: callout - This is shown when the 'repeat' block is introduced.  The word 'path' refers to a path through a maze, and 'block' refers to a child's building block.
Pond.logTooltip: Tooltip for the block that prints debugging information.
Games.hashError: alert - A request to retrieve a stored program does not have a valid URL. %1 is the invalid portion of the URL.
Music.start: The program associated with this label is executed when a button is clicked.  %1 is image of the play icon on the button.
Movie.height:
Label for a rectangle's height input.
{{Identical|Height}}
Turtle.galleryMsg: Label on a button that opens a gallery of drawings made by other users.
Games.runTooltip: tooltip - Pressing this button runs the computer program the user has written.
Games.textVariable:
variable name - Default [https://github.com/google/blockly/wiki/Variables variable] representing a [https://github.com/google/blockly/wiki/Text piece of text].  This should be a single word, preferably short.
{{Identical|Text}}
Turtle.submitTooltip: tooltip - Pressing this button causes the drawing created by the user's program to be submitted to a gallery for other people to see.
Pond.helpText5: Instructions.  Do not translate the word 'stop'.
Turtle.showTurtle: block text - Infinitive or imperative of a verb telling a turtle to show itself (become visible after having been invisible).
Turtle.moveForward: [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus dropdown]] - Infinitive or imperative of a verb telling a turtle to move (walk) in the direction he/she is facing.  This is followed by a number indicating how far (how many pixels) to go.  Prefer a translation that has text in common with the translation of 'move backward'.  See [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus]].
Maze.pathLeft: [[Translating:Blockly#Drop-Down_Menus dropdown]] - Condensed form of 'if there is a path to the left', as in: 'if path to the left, turn left'.
Movie.y2: Label for the y-coordinate of the end of a line.
Games.movie:
title - Specifies that this is Blockly's '''Movie''' game.
{{Identical|Movie}}
Games.catText:
category - Blocks related to [https://github.com/google/blockly/wiki/Text text processing].
{{Identical|Text}}
Pond.helpText1: Instructions. Do not translate the word 'cannon'.
Bird.heading:
block text - the compass direction toward which a traveler or vehicle is or should be moving; course.
{{Identical|Heading}}
Pond.speedTooltip: Tooltip for the block that reports the player's speed.
Turtle.printHelpUrl:
{{Optional}} The URL of a page with basic information about '''printing''' or '''typography'''.
Make sure you use secure HTTPS links, to avoid generating mixed contents and security alerts in browsers when viewing the current page in a secure HTTPS session. If not using Wikipedia, make sure the target is non intrusive, but if in doubt, link to a page in another suitable language supported by a Wikimedia project.
Turtle.helpToolbox: Instructions for accessing blocks that are hidden inside categories.
